title: Professional development and knowledge management strategies for underperforming school improvement

context.prior_knowledge: Completion of advanced studies and experience in executing high-level projects
context.additional_context: A course for in-service secondary mathematics teachers to strengthen school improvement capabilities in low-performing institutions, applying knowledge management cases from MSOs (Multi-School Organizations) for practice-oriented professional development

learning_goals: Participants can design a shared theoretical action framework for school improvement and adapt it to mathematics curriculum characteristics.
Participants can build subject-specific knowledge management systems and propose teacher collaboration processes for sharing expertise using LMS-based collaboration tools.
Participants can develop improvement plans for mathematics lesson design through project-based assessment and establish implementation plans incorporating peer feedback.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
